properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall on Thursday and Thursday night. Total snowfall: 15 to 25 cm. Locations: Newfoundland's interior. Time span: Thursday morning to Friday morning. Remarks: A developing storm is forecast to bring significant snowfall to the island. The heaviest snowfall will occur over Newfoundland's interior, with more of a mixture of snow and rain closer to the coast. Along Newfoundland's east coast, precipitation will fall mostly as rain. The location and total of the maximum snowfall amounts remains uncertain at this time. Temperatures are expected to be mild, which may lead to significantly reduced accumulation. Variations in the track of the system could also shift where the most snow is expected to fall. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-11-21T06:18:41-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-20T14:19:41-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0963934286.2019

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall on Thursday and Thursday night. Total snowfall: 15 to 25 cm. Locations: Newfoundland's interior. Time span: Thursday morning to Friday afternoon. Remarks: A developing storm is forecast to bring significant snowfall to the island. The heaviest snowfall will occur somewhere over Newfoundland's interior, with more of a mixture of snow and rain closer to the coast. Along Newfoundland's east coast, precipitation will fall mostly as rain. The location and total of the maximum snowfall amounts remains uncertain at this time. Temperatures are expected to be mild, which may lead to significantly reduced accumulation. Variations in the track of the system could also shift where the most snow is expected to fall. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall accumulations of near 15 cm expected. Locations: Gander, Grand Falls-Windsor and vicinity, and inland portions of the Bay d'Espoir Highway. Time span: late Thursday morning to near midnight Thursday. Remarks: Snow is expected to develop Thursday morning and become heavy at times early Thursday afternoon. Snow is forecast to taper off to flurries or drizzle overnight Thursday. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-11-21T11:27:15-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-20T19:28:15-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3611684822.2019
Area: Connaigre, Buchans and the interior, Grand Falls-Windsor and vicinity, Gander and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of about 15 cm is expected. Snow will move into the area this evening becoming heavy at times overnight and Thursday morning. Snowfall amounts near 15 cm can be expected by the time the snow tapers off late Thursday morning. This snowfall is due to a developing low pressure system that will track south of the region. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-21T07:41:20-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-20T15:42:20-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1170198833.2019
Area: City of Thunder Bay, Atikokan - Shebandowan - Quetico Park, Cloud Bay - Dorion, Kakabeka Falls - Whitefish Lake - Arrow Lake, Nipigon - Rossport
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A low pressure system is approaching from the west. Strong southerly winds ahead of the low is expected to give blizzard conditions starting Thursday morning. The blizzard should continue until Thursday night when the low moves far enough east. Winter Storm Watches are issued when blizzard conditions are possible. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-21T07:30:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-20T15:31:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2168611390.2019
Area: Cambridge Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snow developing tonight into Thursday. Snow will begin tonight over portions of Northwestern Ontario spreading eastward towards the Quebec border by Thursday morning. Snowfall amounts of 10 to 15 cm are possible by the time the snow ends on Thursday. Areas closer to the shores of Lake Superior may begin as rain and receive less snowfall, particularly east of Marathon towards Wawa. There remains uncertainty regarding the exact location of the highest snowfall amounts. Snowfall warnings may be required for some regions. This snowfall is due to a developing low pressure system that will track across Northeastern Ontario through Thursday. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-21T07:42:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-20T15:43:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3596221204.2019

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm is expected. A low pressure system tracking across the northern United States spread snow across southernmost parts of Saskatchewan yesterday afternoon and throughout the night. This morning, radar shows the snow diminishing in the Shaunavon and Assiniboia regions where the warning has been ended. The snow will also taper off from west to east throughout the late morning and early afternoon hours elsewhere in the south. Total accumulations of 10 to 20 cm are likely near the US border with amounts diminishing as you go north. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-20T23:29:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-20T16:34:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0315580440.2019

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard today and tonight. A low pressure system is bringing snow and blowing snow to areas along the Hudson Bay coast. Winds have strengthened to north 50 or 60 km/h in the area with locally stronger gusts and dropping temperatures. This combination will allow visibilities to drop to the blizzard criterion of 400 metres. Blizzard conditions will start easing at Arviat this evening and at Rankin Inlet Thursday morning as the snow pulls out and winds start to diminish. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-21T07:39:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-20T15:40:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3280008112.2019
Area: Arviat, Rankin Region including Whale Cove
properties.Author: Environment Canada
